intro: Asperula cynanchica subsp. brachysiphon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved woodruff, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and is often found in moist, shaded woodland habitats. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable component of its native ecosystems.
